full_text: Dlr ee | te IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2020/KERI78 PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE ASHOK MENON MONDAY, THE O6TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 16TH POUSHA, 1941 Cri .MC.No.5971 OF 2019 (F) AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CP 4/2019 OF JUDL. FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT-III,NORTH PARAVUR (TEMPORARY) CRIME NO.553/2018 OF Varappuzha Police Station , Ernakulam PETITIONER/S: SUMESH @ SIVAN, AGED 28 YEARS S/O MOHANAN, ELLUM PARAMBIL HOUSE, CHIRAYKKAKAM KARA, VARAPUZHA VILLAGE, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT, PIN-683 517 BY ADV. SRI.SAJEEVAN KURUKKUTTIYULLATHIL RESPONDENT/S: 1 THE STATE OF KERALA REP BY SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, VARAPUZHA POLICE STATION, THROUGH THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. 2 JINOY, AGED 25 YEARS S/O GEORGE, PALLIPPARAMBIL HOUSE, THEVARKAD KARA, VARAPUZHA VILLAGE, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT, PIN-683 517, R2 BY ADV. N.F.JOHN JOSEPH THOMAS OTHER PRESENT: C.S.HRITHWIK-SR.G.P THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Crl.MC.No.5971 OF 2019(F) 2 2020/KERI78 ORDER Dated this the 6th day of January 2020 Petitioner is the sole accused in Crime No.553/2018 of Varapuzha Police Station for having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 341 and 307 of IPC. 2. The de facto complainant and injured is the 2" respondent, who has appeared through counsel and filed affidavit to the effect that the matter has been amicably settled and that he does not have any grievance against the petitioner. A report has also been filed by the investigating officer through the Senior Public Prosecutor. The petitioner does not have any criminal antecedents. The _ injury allegedly sustained by the 2 respondent is not life threatening. There is no public interest involved. In the result, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire proceedings in Crime No.553/2018 of Varapuzha Police Station presently pending as C.P. No.4/2019 on the files of Deeetaes Bie Crl.MC.No.5971 OF 2019(F) 3 2020/KERI78 the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-III, Paravur stands quashed under Section 482 of CrP.C and the accused is discharged.
